heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 08 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 48.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 7.5°C) and outside temperature (down 5.9°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 4.5°C), feels like temperature (up 5.3°C), outside temperature (up 4.5°C), and cloud levels (up 106 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 194.3m higher than yesterday, 89.9m higher than the past week, 105.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 835m to a maximum of 1961m, averaging 1510.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1420.4m and 1615.9m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 6.1°C lower than yesterday, 4.5°C lower than the past week, 3.5°C lower than the past month.

Yesterday, dew point temperatures hit a low of 8.2°C and a high of 14.9°C, averaging 5.8°C; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

Today’s average feels like temperature is 7.5°C lower than yesterday, 5.3°C lower than the past week, 4.7°C lower than the past month.

The feels like temperatures yesterday fell between 8.2°C minimum and 19.2°C maximum, with an average of 5.5°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 10.9°C and 10.3°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
